description:
The ``AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName`` resource specifies a custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway (API Gateway). 
 You can use a custom domain name to provide a URL that's more intuitive and easier to recall. For more information about using custom domain names, see [Set up Custom Domain Name for an API in API Gateway](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/how-to-custom-domains.html) in the *API Gateway Developer Guide*.

MutualTlsAuthentication.description: The mutual TLS authentication configuration for a custom domain name.
MutualTlsAuthentication.markdownDescription:
The mutual TLS authentication configuration for a custom domain name.

---

Required: No  
Type:   
Update requires: No interruption

DomainName.description: The custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway. Uppercase letters are not supported.
DomainName.markdownDescription:
The custom domain name for your API in Amazon API Gateway. Uppercase letters are not supported.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: Replacement

DomainNameConfigurations.markdownDescription:
The domain name configurations.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

Tags.description: The collection of tags associated with a domain name.

.*.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

Tags.markdownDescription:
The collection of tags associated with a domain name.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

TruststoreVersion.description: The version of the S3 object that contains your truststore. To specify a version, you must have versioning enabled for the S3 bucket.
TruststoreVersion.markdownDescription:
The version of the S3 object that contains your truststore. To specify a version, you must have versioning enabled for the S3 bucket.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

TruststoreUri.description: An Amazon S3 URL that specifies the truststore for mutual TLS authentication, for example, ``s3://bucket-name/key-name``. The truststore can contain certificates from public or private certificate authorities. To update the truststore, upload a new version to S3, and then update your custom domain name to use the new version. To update the truststore, you must have permissions to access the S3 object.
TruststoreUri.markdownDescription:
An Amazon S3 URL that specifies the truststore for mutual TLS authentication, for example, ``s3://bucket-name/key-name``. The truststore can contain certificates from public or private certificate authorities. To update the truststore, upload a new version to S3, and then update your custom domain name to use the new version. To update the truststore, you must have permissions to access the S3 object.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

MutualTlsAuthentication.description: If specified, API Gateway performs two-way authentication between the client and the server. Clients must present a trusted certificate to access your API.
MutualTlsAuthentication.markdownDescription:
If specified, API Gateway performs two-way authentication between the client and the server. Clients must present a trusted certificate to access your API.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

OwnershipVerificationCertificateArn.description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) for the public certificate issued by ACMlong. This ARN is used to validate custom domain ownership. It's required only if you configure mutual TLS and use either an ACM-imported or a private CA certificate ARN as the regionalCertificateArn.
OwnershipVerificationCertificateArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon resource name (ARN) for the public certificate issued by ACMlong. This ARN is used to validate custom domain ownership. It's required only if you configure mutual TLS and use either an ACM-imported or a private CA certificate ARN as the regionalCertificateArn.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

EndpointType.markdownDescription:
The endpoint type.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

CertificateName.description: The user-friendly name of the certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.
CertificateName.markdownDescription:
The user-friendly name of the certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

SecurityPolicy.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version of the security policy for this domain name. The valid values are ``TLS_1_0`` and ``TLS_1_2``.
SecurityPolicy.markdownDescription:
The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version of the security policy for this domain name. The valid values are ``TLS_1_0`` and ``TLS_1_2``.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

CertificateArn.description: An AWS-managed certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source.
CertificateArn.markdownDescription:
An AWS-managed certificate that will be used by the edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

DomainNameConfiguration.description:
The ``DomainNameConfiguration`` property type specifies the configuration for an API's domain name.
 ``DomainNameConfiguration`` is a property of the [AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-apigatewayv2-domainname.html) resource.
DomainNameConfiguration.markdownDescription:
The ``DomainNameConfiguration`` property type specifies the configuration for an API's domain name.
 ``DomainNameConfiguration`` is a property of the [AWS::ApiGatewayV2::DomainName](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-apigatewayv2-domainname.html) resource.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption
